    • This buttery soft and breathable organic cotton weighted blanket is ideal for all seasons.

    Weighted blankets have been medically proven to aid naturally deeper sleep cycles. The weight on your body stimulates the production of serotonin (the happy hormone), reduces cortisol (the stress hormone), and increases melatonin, which helps you fall (and stay) asleep. Your Napper should be roughly 10% of your body weight (e.g. 150lb body weight = 15lb Napper)

    Our chunky-knit Cotton Napper helps you sleep more deeply, and wake feeling rested and revitalized.

    Free shipping and easy returns.

    Soft, sustainable fabric is the only thing inside our blanket to give it weight.

    Our organic long-staple cotton is pre-washed for buttery softness – just like your favorite T-shirt.

    - Eco-friendly and safe: Organic cotton that’s gentle on your home and the planet.
    - Responsibly made: Traceable yarn crafted in ethical and equitable workplaces with sustainability in mind.
    - Cotton sourced in alignment with Better Cotton Initiative (BCI) and Fairtrade International principles.

    A healthier choice for your home and the environment: organic cotton uses up to 90% less water than conventional farming methods and is free from harmful chemicals, pesticides, synthetics, or artificial softeners.

    This product is certified according to OEKO-TEX® MADE IN GREEN (certification number: M1YLEE180).

    Wash separately in cold water, on a delicate or permanent-press cycle, using mild or eco-friendly detergent. Tumble dry on low.

    Avoid fabric softeners and bleach.

    Note: your Cotton Napper may take more than one cycle to be fully dried. Avoid hanging your Napper to dry – it'll stretch out its lovely loops. Avoid top-loading washing and drying machines.

    Your Cotton Napper comes with a natural cotton dust bag that makes it easy to store, wash, or take along.

    Learn more: How to wash your Bearaby knitted weighted blanket

    Our Napper is designed for a single person and comes in four different weights:

    10 lbs - 40" x 64"

    15 lbs - 40" x 72"

    20 lbs - 45" x 72"

    25 lbs - 48" x 72"

    Your Napper should be roughly 10% of your body weight (e.g. 150lb body weight = 15lb Napper).

    If you're between weights, we recommend you go with the lower weight category (e.g. 170lb body weight is best suited to a 15lb Napper).

    The best weighted blankets are handmade! Since our Nappers are hand-knit, size and weight can vary slightly between each blanket.

    Our products are handmade with care, and excellent craftsmanship is woven into everything we do. That’s why we offer a 1-year warranty on our Cotton Napper's — so you can rest easy knowing we’ve got you covered.

    Cotton Weighted Blanket

    Size Guide

    Our Nappers are designed to fit your body, not your bed, for personalized weighted blanket benefits.

    Twin Bed 38 x 75 in
    Full Bed 53 x 75 in
    Queen Bed 60 x 80 in
    King Bed 76 x 80 in

    Why don’t weighted blankets cover a whole mattress?

    Our Nappers are sized for a single person to snuggle under to help you get the full benefits of Deep Touch Pressure (DTP)!

    For individual use, we recommend choosing a weighted blanket that’s roughly 10% of your body weight (e.g. 150lb body weight = 15lb Napper).

    If you're between weights, we recommend you go with the lower weight category (e.g. 170lb body weight is best suited to a 15lb Napper).

    If I have a queen/king bed, what blanket should I choose?

    If you plan to use your weighted blanket alone on a queen/king bed, we recommend choosing an individual-size Napper that weighs roughly 10% of your body weight.

    If you plan to share your weighted blanket with a partner or you prefer a blanket that covers your entire mattress, we recommend opting for our queen/king size Hugger.

    Weighted blanket calculator

    We recommend 10% of your body weight.

    If you’re in between weights, we recommend rounding down to the lower weight option — or use our calculator to make it easy.

    Materials

    Made from sustainably farmed organic cotton

    LEARN MORE

    Frequently Asked Questions

    How do weighted blankets work?

    Science shows that sleeping under weight improves sleep quality, lowers stress, and eases anxiety – and when those things are better, everything’s better!

    Here’s a breakdown of the science that lies underneath our cozy and calming Nappers:

    • Activates the effects of Deep Touch Pressure (DTP)
      • Increases serotonin to make you feel happier and more content
      • Increases melatonin to lull you into blissful slumber
      • Decreases cortisol to help reduce anxiety and stress
    • Mimics the effects of ‘grounding’ or ‘earthing’
    • Mimics the sensation of a warm hug

    If you’re looking for more information, read our deep-dive into how weighted blankets work.

    What are the health benefits of weighted blankets?

    The most significant health benefits of weighted blankets include improved sleep and reduced feelings of anxiety and stress.

    The benefit of a heavy knit blanket is the even weight distribution, which helps to extend the comfort of Deep Touch Pressure (DTP) to your full body.

    What is the ideal weighted blanket weight?

    The recommended weighted blanket weight is 10% of your body weight. For someone who weighs 150 pounds, your best bet is the 15 lb weighted blanket. For someone closer to 200 lbs, we recommend our 20 lb blanket.

    If you’re in-between weights, we recommend rounding down to the lower weight option. Our Nappers are available in 10, 15, 20, and 25 lb weight options.

    We also carry 5 and 7 lb weighted blankets, the Nappling, designed especially for kids.

    How do you wash a woven weighted blanket?

    Our Nappers are machine washable!

    • Wash separately in cold or lukewarm water (max 90 °F)
    • Select either the delicate or permanent-press cycle
    • Use only gentle or mild detergent
    • Avoid using fabric softener
    • Tumble dry on low heat – please note it may take more than one round for your Napper to dry completely
    • Never hang your Napper up to dry – it’ll stretch!

    Make sure to check your washing machine’s weight capacity before washing your Napper. Our delightfully heavy blankets are great for deep sleep, but it’s essential to check beforehand if the washing machine model you have can bear the full weight of your blanket.

    Read more: How to wash your weighted blanket.

    What is the difference between the Cotton Napper and the Tree Napper?

    It’s simple: if you like it cozy, usually don’t get overly hot at night, share the bed with a furry friend, and you want a Napper you can use all year round – the Cotton Napper is for you.

    If you tend to sleep hot and often find yourself waking up feeling a bit sweaty every night – the Tree Napper is your new best friend.

    Our original Cotton Napper is made from 100% sustainably-farmed cotton. Our Tree Napper is made of TENCEL™, a fiber made from the wood pulp of trees grown and replaced on specialized tree farms. Our TENCEL™ comes from eucalyptus wood pulp, making it extra cooling and completely biodegradable.

    While the Cotton Napper and Tree Napper both have the same braided blanket design, they’re made with different materials to suit different snuggle preferences.

    It took comparing two weights to get it right, but now that I have, I want this thing all the time! I think that even though I am carrying a bit of extra weight right now, I am still basically a petite-framed person at 5'3"". The fifteen pound blanket did feel nice, but on nights when my restless legs were bad, I was too aware of the weight of it when I tried to rollover. This would cause me to become completely awake, struggling against the blanket. The ten pound blanket is just right. Heads up: the 10 pound blanket is shorter than the other weights. This might be an issue for taller persons. So perhaps height and body frame should be taken into consideration, as well as a person's weight. It is also worth mentioning that the construction of the blanket does truly allow for ventilation, so that you do not become overheated as the blanket warms up. In fact, on cooler nights, I have found myself needing an extra lightweight cotton blanket. Only time will tell what I need to pair with it during cold winter months, but that is a much easier fix for me than having a weighted blanket that is too heavy to sleep under when it is warm. I am thankful that the blanket's first function is weight and not warmth. And due to Bearaby's special fabric and construction, they seem to have nailed that part. I am a very satisfied customer.

    As a retired mental health professional in my late 70's, I can't believe I didn't discover the efficacy of a weighted blanket sooner. After my doctor ruled out medical reasons for my complaint of feeling tired most of the time, I was convinced that I wasn't resting well at night. I found myself getting heavy blankets out to cover me even though it's summer here in Florida! As I often do, I decided to do some research & came up with articles on how weighted blankets may improve sleep quality. I linked that theory to my recent use of heavy blankets. My next step was to research the various types of weighted blankets & decided I liked the idea of a cotton knit. Being a well seasoned knitter, I then searched for patterns & yarns but soon concluded that to knit one in the luxury yarn & size I wanted, that would equal 10 percent of my body weight turned out to be too difficult for me to figure out. Reviews also commented that DIY cost about as much as buying one. After eliminating brand after brand I came upon Bearaby, specifically the Cotton Napper. I have been sleeping under it's evenly distributed weight now for the past couple of weeks, & I cannot believe the difference it has made. I've been experiencing a deeper & more restful sleep, EVERY SINGLE NIGHT & I no longer get up in the morning feeling extremely fatigued, that's life changing for me. Thank you for my beautiful Bearaby cotton Napper.
